meta.note: Season trend summary based on Week 1 data only.

league_insights.summary: Week 1 was dominated by blowouts. League-wide scoring was high (avg ~105), but margins were large (avg ~36), producing few true nail-biters. Several managers left high-scoring players on benches, creating large latent scoring swings across matchups.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Explosive WR production + mobile QB. Balanced receiving outperformance drove a top league score.
top_player_impacts: Zay Flowers (28.1) and Garrett Wilson (22.5) far exceeded projections and were primary drivers.
Caleb Williams (24.2) also outscored expectations and boosted QB scoring.

bench_misses.note: Poor bench QB outing (negative vs projection) but no impact on win.

team_trends.notes: Best scoring team this week; offensive depth and WR returns produced dominant result. Projected playoff seed candidate due to highest points-for.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Mixed WR/TE contributions but catastrophic D/ST performance dragged total down.
top_player_impacts: Michael Pittman Jr. (20.0) outperformed and was a positive.

bench_misses.note: Benched QB with a large score; leaving him inactive cost a major potential swing.
Bench TE projected to contribute but produced nothing.

team_trends.notes: Loss driven by an unusually poor D/ST (-7) and several underperforming starters despite decent receiver output.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Workhorse RB and primary WR massively outperformed; strong QB play contributed.
top_player_impacts: Derrick Henry (29.2) and Deebo Samuel (22.6) both wildly outperformed projections and were engines of the week.
J.J. McCarthy (22.22) provided solid QB production.

bench_misses.note: Strong bench RB — sizable unused scoring but starters still produced enough to win.

team_trends.notes: High total and efficient starters. Depth produced more upside than used; strong early contender for top playoff seeding based on points.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Solid QB/RB week but leading WR underperformed; kicker overperformance helped keep score respectable.
top_player_impacts: Jalen Hurts (solid dual-threat week) and kicker Ka'imi Fairbairn (14.0) added meaningful points.

bench_misses.note: Bench TD and strong WR output would have narrowed the loss.

team_trends.notes: Amon-Ra St. Brown underperformed relative to expectations, limiting ceiling despite other contributions.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Defense provided a large bonus and steady WR contributions complemented it.
top_player_impacts: Broncos D/ST (16.0) massively outperformed projections and was a decisive factor.
Jaxon Smith-Njigba (19.4) and Courtland Sutton (18.1) delivered dependable WR scoring.

bench_misses.note: Bench WR produced double-digit points and could have increased margin.

team_trends.notes: Team won despite Tyreek Hill underperforming — defense and WR depth carried the day.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Strong RB day (Bijan Robinson, Breece Hall) but multiple WR/TE underperformances and a negative flex limited totals.
top_player_impacts: Bijan Robinson (24.4) and Breece Hall (16.5) were positives.

bench_misses.note: Bench RB with modest points; not a major swing.

team_trends.notes: Good RB production offset by underperforming pass-catchers; roster needs improved WR/TE output to be consistently competitive.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Balanced attack — elite QB rushing and breakout WR/CMC combined for one of the top totals.
top_player_impacts: Lamar Jackson (29.36), Emeka Egbuka (23.6), and Christian McCaffrey (23.2) all outperformed projections and produced a dominant result.
team_trends.notes: Top-tier Week 1 performance; high floor/high ceiling starters and WR breakout suggest a strong early-season contender.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Low output across QB, RB, and WR with multiple starters badly underperforming. Bench had big scores that went unused.

bench_misses.note: Huge bench QB score — critical missed start.
Bench WR with big points; two bench players alone would have added ~49 points.

team_trends.notes: Benching high-scoring players cost competitiveness; starter underperformance created one of the lowest team totals.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: High QB output paired with RB contributions and an overperforming D/ST produced a large win.
top_player_impacts: Justin Herbert (27.92) and James Cook (21.2) outpaced projections and fueled the offense.
Colts D/ST (14.0) added a valuable boost.

bench_misses.note: Bench QB had a solid outing but starter outperformed.

team_trends.notes: Strong start; balanced scoring with defense contributing meaningfully.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Severe underperformance from multiple high-profile starters (WR/TE/QB) produced the lowest team total of Week 1.

bench_misses.note: Bench TE provided minor unused scoring.

team_trends.notes: A.J. Brown, Joe Burrow, Mark Andrews, and Xavier Worthy all severely underperformed versus projections — a historical one-week collapse in scoring.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Elite QB performance (Josh Allen) drove an oversized portion of the total; WR compliments provided additional scoring.
top_player_impacts: Josh Allen (38.76) delivered the single largest Week 1 performance and was the decisive factor.
Hollywood Brown (19.9) provided strong WR scoring.

bench_misses.note: Bench QB also had a massive week; unused but indicative of roster strength.

team_trends.notes: Huge QB carry; stacked QB depth and complementary WRs made this a top offensive showing.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Underperforming skill players and large bench scores left unused contributed to a lopsided loss.

bench_misses.note: Bench QB with significant points left unused.
Bench TE produced a TD; notable missed value.

team_trends.notes: Multiple starters (Terry McLaurin, Pacheco, Stevenson) underperformed; bench decisions were costly.

team_trends.team: If Ur Not First You're Last
team_trends.scoring_pattern: Solid QB play (Mahomes) with role WR/TE contributions but overall a below-average winning score.
top_player_impacts: Patrick Mahomes (26.02) exceeded projection and was the primary scoring engine.
team_trends.notes: Won with a modest total; relied on QB steadiness rather than explosive committee scoring.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Poor QB outing and overall weak offensive production; bench held a major positive that was left unused.

bench_misses.note: Huge bench WR — leaving him inactive was a critical missed opportunity.

team_trends.notes: Benched upside and poor QB performance combined to produce a low score and an easy loss.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Balanced RB scoring and steady QB output; defense underperformed but did not prevent a win.
top_player_impacts: J.K. Dobbins (14.8) and steady RB/backup WR contributions formed the core of the scoring.
team_trends.notes: Victory built on RB production and depth despite a D/ST that fell below projection.

team_trends.scoring_pattern: Puka Nacua delivered, but QB and other WRs underperformed limiting the team's ceiling.
top_player_impacts: Puka Nacua (23.1) was the primary bright spot.

bench_misses.note: Bench QB had a serviceable outing but did not swing result.

team_trends.notes: Good individual WR performance could not overcome broader offensive underperformance.

week1_standouts.impact_note: Single largest Week 1 performance; directly drove a dominant win.
High QB rushing/return that paired with strong RB/WR outputs to generate one of the highest team totals.
Workhorse RB explosion that materially influenced a top scoring effort.
Large bench QB score — indicator of roster depth and/or missed start if active.
Huge bench QB score that, if started, would have reversed a weak team outcome.
Pair of WRs massively outperformed projections and were primary scoring drivers.

week1_underperformers.impact_note: Large negative vs projection for a typically high-floor WR; reduced expected upside.
Major underperformance contributing to team's historically low total.
Low QB output compounded ensemble underperformance.

bench_swing_summary.insight: Multiple teams left 20+ point bench performances unused, significantly altering several matchup outcomes or margins.

notable_risky_decisions.impact: Large missed scoring opportunity that would have materially changed the matchup.

notable_risky_decisions.action: Benched Daniel Jones (29.48) and Keenan Allen (19.8)
notable_risky_decisions.impact: Two bench players combined for ~49 points — a critical management error for a team that scored 84.02.
Benched WR with large score cost the ability to compete.

notable_risky_decisions.action: Benched Aaron Rodgers (25.66) and Dalton Kincaid (14.8)
notable_risky_decisions.impact: Significant unused bench scoring while multiple starters underperformed.

notable_smart_decisions.impact: Maximized elite QB performance that produced the week's single largest individual score.
Defense outperformed and provided a decisive edge in the matchup.

notable_smart_decisions.action: Started Justin Herbert and Colts D/ST
notable_smart_decisions.impact: Both players exceeded expectations and added toward a large team total.

playoff_driven_analysis.playoff_format: Top 6 teams by record (then head-to-head, then Points For) qualify

current_playoff_projection_after_week1.rationale: Highest Points For among 1-0 teams; dominant Week 1 performance.
Balanced elite performances produced a top-tier points total.
High-scoring week driven by Henry and Deebo; strong early points profile.
Solid QB/RB/Defense combination produced a large score and early seeding advantage.
Elite QB carry and supporting WR output place them among early playoff qualifiers.
Win aided by defensive outperformance; among top six Points For of winners.

playoff_driven_analysis.playoff_notes: With only one week played, all six playoff spots are decided by Points For among 1-0 teams. Early indicators: teams that combined elite QB/RB weeks with complementary WR or defensive outperformance earned the highest Points For and early playoff placement. Owners who left multi-20 point bench performances unused may be at a disadvantage over the season if that pattern continues.
